TopicTitle: Is KSP on Xbox just regular KSP software altered to run on consoles, or is it software built from the ground up to run on consoles?

Articles.Content:
Long story short, Xbox systems and software is built upon Windows.  So, what a lot of game ports do is they take the PC game, alter it a little bit so it runs on console, and leave 90% of the PC game software/systems/files untouched.

This means that the way the game files work and the file directories on Xbox are essentially the same as on PC.

If this is the case with Console KSP, I might be able to find the craft file folder on my Xbox, and see if I can get file sharing working between Xbox consoles.

 

This idea comes from a complete noob on this topic though, all input is appreciated.
KSP was made for desktops, then the code was turned over to an outside business for conversion to a console version. How much change that involved I could not say.
